newsitem.title: USA: Harrison Cty, Miss., to vote on $23 mln school GOs.
newsitem.headline: Harrison Cty, Miss., to vote on $23 mln school GOs.

text.p: Mississippi's Harrison County has scheduled a Nov 5 referendum on $23 million of general obligation bonds for schools, an aide to Superintendent Henry Arledge said Monday.

Although Nov 5 was already the date for the general election, the county had to call a special election for the school bond referendum. The school board approved the referendum Sept 9, four days too late to comply with a state law requiring it to give the county elections commission 60 days notice to prepare the ballots.
Rather than incur the cost of a second election, the school board asked the county to declare a special election, which does not require 60 days notice.
County elections officials agreed to do so after the state attorney general said the procedure was legal.
Bond proceeds would finance construction of two new elementary schools and classroom additions at two high schools. About $5 million would also be used for school construction.
